intro: Capsella viguieri, commonly known as the French peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Capsella viguieri is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
